choices.C: the investigator has to get a warrant
choices.B: the investigator does not have to get a warrant
choices.A: the users have standard corporate equipment and software
choices.D: the users can load whatever they want on their machines

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
(B) the investigator does not have to get a warrant

âœ… Corporate investigators have easier access to company resources without legal barriers
Even in a civil case, "The claimant is responsible for the collection and analysis of the evidence". From EC Council materials.

questions.question_text: Corporate investigations are typically easier than public investigations because:

choices.C: Start and end points for log files are specified
choices.B: Start and end points for log files are not specified
choices.D: Start and end points for log sequence numbers are not specified
choices.A: Start and end points for log sequence numbers are specified

discussion.content:
The answer should be = D.Start and end points for log sequence numbers are not specified.
According to the EC-council Database Forensic Module - In the Collecting Active Transaction Logs Using SQL Server Management Studio section, "Assigning NULL value imply that the start and end points for the log sequence numbers LSN are not specified"

Selected Answer: D
SELECT * FROM ::fn_dblog(NULL, NULL)
Explanation of each part - 

SELECT:
A SQL keyword used to retrieve data from a database.

*:
wildcard character instructs SQL to return all available columns from the source.

FROM:
A SQL keyword indicating the data source. Everything that follows FROM specifies which table, view, or function is being queried.

::fn_dblog:
fn_dblog is an undocumented, read-only table-valued SQL function. It allows viewing transaction log records. The prefix (::) is a required syntax element for calling certain built-in functions or internal functions in SQL.

(NULL, NULL):
fn_dblog typically accepts two parameters representing a starting Log Sequence Number (LSN) and an ending LSN to define which log records to retrieve.

NULL, NULL means that no specific start or end LSN is defined.
Thus, the function returns all active log records in the transaction log.

Selected Answer: D
D < Assigning NULL values implies that the start and end points for log sequence numbers (LSNs) are not specified

Selected Answer: D
According to EC Council, (NULL,NULL) means the start and end points are not specified.

questions.question_text: While collecting Active Transaction Logs using SQL Server Management Studio, the query Select * from ::fn_dblog(NULL, NULL) displays the active portion of the transaction log file. Here, assigning NULL values implies?

choices.C: All the values in this key are executed at system start-up
choices.D: All values in this subkey run when specific user logs on and then the values are deleted
choices.B: The string specified in the value run executes when user logs on
choices.A: All the values in this subkey run when specific user logs on, as this setting is user-specific

questions.question_text:
Which of the following statements is TRUE with respect to the Registry settings in the user start-up folder HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows
\CurrentVersion\RunOnce\

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D > All values in this key are executed at system startup and are deleted later.
The RunOnce key makes the program run one time, and then the key is deleted.

questions.question_text: Which cloud model allows an investigator to acquire the instance of a virtual machine and initiate the forensics examination process?

discussion.content:
B. IaaS model (Infrastructure as a Service)

In the IaaS model, users have control over virtual machines and storage resources. This control allows investigators to access and analyze the virtual machines for forensic purposes, as they can manage and interact with the instances directly.

questions.question_text: An attacker successfully gained access to a remote Windows system and plans to install persistent backdoors on it. Before that, to avoid getting detected in future, he wants to cover his tracks by disabling the last-accessed timestamps of the machine. What would he do to achieve this?

choices.D: Run the command fsutil behavior set enablelastaccess 0
choices.B: Run the command fsutil behavior set disablelastaccess 0
choices.C: Set the registry value of HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\FileSystem\NtfsDisableLastAccessUpdate to 1
choices.A: Set the registry value of HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\FileSystem\NtfsDisableLastAccessUpdate to 0

discussion.content:
C < 
0 User Managed, Last Access Time Updates Enabled
1 User Managed, Last Access Time Updates Disabled
2 (default) System Managed, Last Access Time Updates Enabled
3 System Managed, Last Access Time Updates Disabled
Anser is right. Right command for fsutil is: fsutil behavior query disablelastaccess
